titles.title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study to assess the suitability and feasibility of designating certain land as the Finger Lakes National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 115-227.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 375.

bill.summary:
Finger Lakes National Heritage Area Study Act
This bill directs the Department of the Interior to assess the suitability and feasibility of designating specified counties and other areas in the state of New York as the Finger Lakes National Heritage Area.
